sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑驚↑↓おどろ↓きのあま|り↑口↑↓くち|↓もきけなかった。
sdata.e: I was too surprised to speak.

sdata.j: ロープにしっかりつかまりながら、↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑無事↑↓ぶじ↓↑陸地↑↓|りくち|↓に↑着↑↓つ↓いた。
sdata.e: Holding on to the rope firmly, I came safely to land.

sdata.j: リンダ・ウッドが↑入口↑↓い|りくち|↓に↑立↑↓た↓っていました。
sdata.e: Linda Wood was standing at the door.

sdata.e: It was difficult for me to find the entrance to that building.

sdata.j: その↑建物↑↓たてもの↓の↑入↑↓い↓|り↑口↑↓くち|↓で↑待↑↓ま↓っていてください。

sdata.e: The shock robbed her of her speech.

sdata.e: Those 4 degrees meant that 30 percent of the land area of the world was covered in ice.

sdata.e: A slip of the tongue often brings about unexpected results.

sdata.e: Ranks of police guarded the entrance.
